column4: Hi all. I've got huge problem: gparted see hdd as 150 GB which is utter bl since there are 2 os's on it (ubuntu / windows). The 'fdisk -l' says it cannot access device and one time (i don't remeber name of software) I've got info about missing prtition table. What I can do to restory it to working state?
what device are you using with fdisk -l ?
/dev/sda
are you doing it as root?
good point. Now I get the output. Looks norml thou it does not work so.
I don't know what you mean by "it does not work so"
I am using live usbe atm. I wanted to format old ubuntu install and make new one but gparted see hdd as empty space.
could you pastebin the output from fdisk -l ?
That would be problematic as the machine with the problem also refuses to make eth0 connection. It is samsunch netbook.
*samsung
fdisk -l says there's no partitions?
No. The fdisk shows all of them. Gparted ergo the install program has problems. Let me check it again.

Nope. Still it looks like unallocated space. Maybe this is related but few days ago it stopped booting. It started the bios and then restarted. I reinstalled grub from live cd and everything was working till yesterday as I was performing dist updated and some hanges.
I'm confused. fdisk -l shows partitions, but gparted shows all unallocated space on /dev/sda ?
excacly.
you're running gparted as root as well?
yes.
when you run gparted from terminal, do you see any messages in the terminal?
Right now I am booting into ubuntu installed on the hdd (the one I want to reinstall).
ok. in any case, someone had a similar problem to you, and found that the drive had overlapping partitions. It may be relevant to your case: http://gparted-forum.surf4.info/viewtopic.php?id=1161
I have to attend to other things. good luck!
I will check that out. Thank you.
It is exacly the same as in the link. One more question. Do you knew the software that the person is reffering to? The "testdisk". I can't find it in a live cd or repositories.
